skill.name: pubchem-database
skill.description: Query PubChem via PUG-REST API/PubChemPy (110M+ compounds). Search by name/CID/SMILES, retrieve properties, similarity/substructure searches, bioactivity, for cheminformatics.
skill.summary: Query PubChem via PUG-REST API/PubChemPy (110M+ compounds). Search by name/CID/SMILES, retrieve prop...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate scientific tool for accessing the PubChem chemical database. Static analysis findings are false positives - the 'external commands' are installation instructions, 'network' calls are to official NIH/NCBI servers, and no actual cryptographic code exists. The skill enables researchers to query molecular properties, perform similarity searches, and access bioactivity data.

content.value_statement: Researchers need quick access to molecular properties and chemical structures. This skill connects to PubChem's 110M+ compound database for instant cheminformatics queries.
actual_capabilities: Search 110M+ chemical compounds by name, CID, SMILES, or InChI
Retrieve molecular properties (MW, LogP, TPSA, hydrogen bonding)
Access bioactivity data from screening assays
Download molecular structures as images or SDF files
limitations: Requires internet connection to access PubChem API
Rate limited to 5 requests per second maximum
Some properties unavailable for certain compounds

use_cases.title: Drug candidate screening
use_cases.description: Screen compounds for drug-like properties using Lipinski's Rule of Five

use_cases.title: Structure-activity relationship analysis
use_cases.description: Find structurally similar compounds and compare their bioactivities

use_cases.title: Chemical identifier conversion
use_cases.description: Convert between SMILES, InChI, and compound names for publications

prompt_templates.title: Basic compound search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search PubChem for aspirin and show its molecular formula, weight, and SMILES

prompt_templates.title: Property comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Get molecular properties for aspirin, ibuprofen, and naproxen. Compare their LogP values

prompt_templates.title: Similarity search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for compounds similar to imatinib with 85% similarity threshold, then filter by MW 200-600

prompt_templates.title: Substructure screening
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all compounds containing a benzene ring and calculate their average molecular weight

output_examples.input: Search for caffeine and show its key properties

best_practices: Use CIDs instead of names for repeated queries to improve performance
Implement 0.2-0.3 second delays between requests to respect rate limits
Cache results locally for frequently accessed compounds
anti_patterns: Don't make more than 5 requests per second - you'll hit rate limits
Avoid searching by common names without checking synonyms first
Don't ignore error handling for compounds that might not exist

faq.question: What is PubChem?
faq.answer: PubChem is the world's largest freely available chemical database with over 110 million compounds, maintained by NCBI/NIH.

faq.question: How do I search by chemical structure?
faq.answer: Use SMILES strings or InChI notation. Example: 'CC(=O)OC1=CC=CC=C1C(=O)O' for aspirin.

faq.question: What properties can I retrieve?
faq.answer: Molecular weight, LogP, TPSA, hydrogen bond counts, and over 50 other molecular descriptors.

faq.question: Why am I getting timeout errors?
faq.answer: Similarity and substructure searches are asynchronous and may take 15-30 seconds. Reduce MaxRecords if needed.

faq.question: Can I download molecular structures?
faq.answer: Yes, you can download as PNG images, SDF files, or JSON format using the download functions.

faq.question: Is there a rate limit?
faq.answer: Yes, maximum 5 requests per second and 400 requests per minute to ensure fair usage.
